intro: Diplacrum capitatum, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Diplacrum capitatum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native habitat.
